Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing the Trachway and Airway Scope for Tracheal Intubation by Novice Operators

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised cross-over study was conducted in a simulated setting

Participants.evidence: novice operators who had no prior experience in tracheal intubation

Intervention.evidence: The study compared the Trachway and Airway Scope

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate its effectiveness compared to the Airway Scope for tracheal intubation by novice operators.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the time required for successful tracheal intubation, measured immediately after each attempt.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applicable due to the nature of the intervention.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 50 participants were randomised

Number_Analysed.evidence: with each participant using both devices

Result_Outcome.evidence: The average intubation time did not differ significantly between the Trachway and Airway Scope in the normal airway scenario (11.2 ± 6.5 vs. 9.8 ± 4.3 seconds; p = 0.07). However, in the difficult airway scenario, intubation time was significantly longer with the Trachway (17.1 ± 11.1 vs. 9.5 ± 4.1 seconds; p < 0.001).
